LLM
1LLM
I tried to explain the importance and working of llama-index in simple words
Problem statement
If you have a small dataset and you want ask a query on that data, you can give it to a  
large language model such as ChatGPT to handle both the data and questions.  
However , if your dataset is large, what you can do.  
When we want to query on any document. W e can follow below methods
1. Fine tune your own LLM.
2. Load all your documents into one prompt on to LLMs.
3. Feed relevant info along with query
Fine-tuning your own model is expensive and requires high-spec machines. It also  
takes more time, which is why it is not feasible for us. Loading all the documents is also  
impractical if it takes 100k tokens, making it more expensive. Therefore, the third  
method of feeding relevant information is the best solution, and Llamaindex has chosen  
to use it.
Steps in Llamaindex

LLM
2
1.  Load the files into Llamaindex
Ready-made readers are available for  sources such as databases, Discord, Slack,  
Google Docs, Notion, and GitHub repos.
2. Parse the documents into chunks of text (Nodes)
3. Construction of index for each nodes
When we query the documents, LlamaIndex can quickly retrieve the relevant data using  
this index. The index can be stored in dif ferent ways, but we will use a V ector Store
4. Store this index
5. Run a query
We run a query and Llamaindex calculates a similarity score between the query and the  
vectorized database documents. Similarity scores can be measured using cosine  
similarity , Euclidean distance, etc.
After finding the similarity scores, the top n documents along with their associated  
questions will be sent to llm.
Finally , llm will perform its own NLP processes and provide an answer .
However , the challenge lies in accurately calculating the similarity score, as the  
accuracy of the answer depends on it.
Example on custom knowledge base

LLM

python -m venv env
2. Install required libraries
# Install llama_indexpip install llama-index and other libraries 
pip install llama-index
